docs.snippet: Criminal charges, suspensions and heavy fines against players represent an escalation in the attempt to stem the persistent and widespread problem of racism in European soccer.
docs.lead_paragraph: Criminal charges, suspensions and heavy fines against players represent an escalation in the attempt to stem the persistent and widespread problem of racism in European soccer.
docs.abstract: John Terry, captain of England’s national soccer team and powerful club Chelsea, faces a criminal charge over accusations that he made a racial slur during an October match, apparently becoming the first player to be prosecuted for remarks said on the field; Terry denies claim but the accusation represents an escalation in the attempt to stem the persistent and widespread problem of racism in European soccer; comes on heels of Liverpool forward Luis Suarez being suspended for on-field racial slur.

headline.seo: In England, Star Players Accused of Racist Comments
headline.main: Racism Charges Put a Sport on Edge

byline.contributor: Rob Hughes contributed reporting from London.

docs.snippet: Liverpool is backing Luis Suárez after he was banned for eight games for allegedly having used a racist term during a match, and the club said it would fight to clear his name.
